{"step_by_step_thinking": "Odontogenic keratocyst is a cystic lesion that arises from the remnants of the dental lamina. It is not directly associated with infection periapically, so option A can be ruled out. Odontogenic keratocyst is indeed developmental in origin, arising from the dental lamina, so option B is correct. Aspiration is not a definitive treatment for odontogenic keratocyst, so option C is incorrect. Odontogenic keratocyst has a high recurrence rate, so option D is incorrect.", "answer_choice": "B"}
